Key Match Events: West Indies captain Rovman Powell led his team to a five-wicket triumph with six balls to spare.
Papua New Guinea scored 136 for 8 in their 20 overs.
Roston Chase was the man of the match with an unbeaten 42 runs and economical bowling figures of 4 overs for 26 runs.
Assad Vala of Papua New Guinea scored 21 runs and took 2 wickets for 28 runs.
Sese Bau top-scored for Papua New Guinea with 50 runs.
Andre Russell and Alzarri Joseph took 2 wickets each for the West Indies.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies coach Daren Sammy received a visit from Trinidad and Tobago calypsonian David Rudder on the eve of the match.
Roston Chase mentioned that the West Indies team did not take their opponents lightly and approached the game with the mentality of playing against a top team like Australia or India.
Post-Match Reflections: Rovman Powell acknowledged that Papua New Guinea's score was a bit too generous by his bowlers and praised PNG's smart play.
Assad Vala expressed satisfaction with his team's competitive score but felt they missed a trick towards the end.
Roston Chase was pleased with his performance and the fact that the West Indies started with a win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of a modest audience in Providence, Guyana.
West Indies opted to start without opener Shai Hope, rookie pacer Shamar Joseph, and hometown favorite Shimron Hetmyer.
PNG were 57/4 after their first 10 overs but managed to add 37 runs in the last three overs.
